alert.note: Alert for Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 7:10PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...Strong outflow winds from thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Otero County through 745 PM MDT... At 709 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorm outflow winds along a line extending from 8 miles north of Tularosa to near Holloman Air Force Base. Movement was east at 40 mph. Gusty winds and blowing dust is likely over the next hour. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Tularosa, Three Rivers, Alamogordo, White Sands National Monument, Bent, Burro Flats, La Luz, Holloman Air Force Base, Boles Acres, Oliver Lee State Park and Three Rivers Petroglyph Site. This includes the following highways... Highway 54 in New Mexico between mile markers 50 and 100. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet
